alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:15PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT FOR SUSSEX...KENT AND SOUTHERN CAROLINE COUNTIES... At 615 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Viola to near Andrewsville to near Seaford, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Dover, Georgetown, Milford, Seaford, Denton, Millsboro, Laurel, Harrington, Camden, Lewes, Federalsburg, Milton, Selbyville, Bridgeville, Delmar, Dagsboro, Preston, Millville, Ellendale and Bowers. People at the Delaware State Fair should seek safe shelter immediately! THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
